author: Phillip Nieto
title: CNN Fact Checks Trump's False Claims Made At Mar-A-Lago
text:
CNN reporter Tom Foreman fact-checked many of the claims made by former President Donald Trump regarding the economy and immigration.
Trump spoke to reporters at a press conference on Thursday at Mar-a-Lago , where the Republican nominee slammed Kamala Harris‚Äôs intelligence, and popularity. Trump also claimed the U.S. economy was headed toward a depression.
The former president also claimed that Biden was forced out of the presidency by his fellow Democrats.
Foreman joined a CNN panel following the event to ‚Äòunpack‚Äô many of the false claims made by Trump.
There is a lot to unpack in terms of falsehoods. Let‚Äôs start with the economy, a big thing for many issues out there. He said we could literally be in the throes of a depression, not a recession. He said close to 1920s depression, 1920s the depression was 25% unemployment. We‚Äôre at 4.3% now. Not even close, not even the same ballgame. He also mentioned, weirdly enough, people can‚Äôt buy bacon. I checked on bacon sales. They seem to be doing just fine. On the border, as Brianna noted earlier, he grossly overinflated the number of people coming over the border there. He also repeated a claim that he‚Äôs made many times before that he really must like, even as the numbers fall here, saying this notion that people are coming out of mental institutions and prisons, as he said, all over the world, are emptying into the United States, he said this many times, never offered any proof about Kamala Harris.
He says she‚Äôs the most unpopular, worst vice president in history. Couldn‚Äôt pass her bar exam. Scholars surveyed by the L.A. Times , ranked VP‚Äôs from 1933 on. They put Harris at 11 out of 18. Not great. Certainly not the worst. And she did pass her bar exam, even though she had to do it more than once. He said President Biden had the presidency taken away from him. Not true. That is false. President Biden agreed to leave the presidency. He wasn‚Äôt happy about it. Nobody would be. But he agreed to leave. And he backs Harris and her campaign.
He said everybody wanted Roe v Wade overturned. The country overwhelmingly wanted this and returned to the States. Not true. Even now, more than two years afterward, a Pew study said that 63% of people still think abortion nationwide should largely be legal, not left up to the states. And one more thing. He talked for quite some time there about how he protected Hillary Clinton and always wanted to keep her safe, but at least more than a half dozen times in recent years, he has said publicly she should go to jail and a whole lot of other Democrats as well.
Watch the clip above via CNN .
Have a tip we should know? tips@mediaite.com

author: Duck Thurgood
title: This AI tool could help cities improve accessibility at intersections | Utah Public Radio
text: This AI tool could help cities improve accessibility at intersections Researchers at Utah State University are developing an AI tool to identify accessibility issues at intersections, which could make it easier for cities to find and fix those issues. There are many features intersections use for convenience and accessibility ‚Äî walk signs with visual and verbal cues, curb ramps with textured bumps, and clearly marked crosswalks, to name a few. Sometimes, however, these features may be insufficient, broken, or completely absent, making it harder for especially those with disabilities to get around. ‚ÄúIn some cities, they have a barrier in the middle of the road that a person in a wheelchair can‚Äôt get over,‚Äù said Mary Ellen Heiner, the senior coordinator of projects at USU‚Äôs [Institute for Disability, Research, Policy & Practice](https://idrpp.usu.edu/) (IDRPP). ‚ÄúOr even a person who‚Äôs blind, they come to that island and they can‚Äôt get on ... they don‚Äôt know where a ramp is on it, if there is one.‚Äù What causes lack of accessibility This lack of accessibility features is caused by a number of factors. Not all engineers or city planners are trained in accessibility, and even when they do know what standards to reach for, making things accessible can be more time-consuming and expensive. ‚ÄúA lot of times, I think we‚Äôre always trying to save money at the expense of accessibility,‚Äù said Matthew Wappett, executive director at IDRPP. A lot of infrastructure in the U.S. was also built before accessibility standards were set with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) in 1990. ‚ÄúSo we have this aging infrastructure that‚Äôs just not up to date with current standards,‚Äù Wappett said. Heiner also noted that even when things are compliant with the ADA, they may not be truly accessible because of how much the world has changed in the last 34 years. ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt take into consideration that buildings change, that mobility equipment has changed, that IT equipment has changed,‚Äù Heiner said. ‚ÄúBuildings say that they‚Äôre accessible because they follow the ADA, but they‚Äôre not given current technology that we have.‚Äù How this project helps To help with that problem, Chamberlain and his team have been [developing an AI tool](https://www.usu.edu/today/story/usu-researchers-develop-ai-tool-to-identify-accessibility-issues-at-intersections/?nl=981) for the past nearly two years that can recognize accessibility issues at intersections. Researchers train the AI by giving it thousands and thousands of images they‚Äôve labeled with important objects, like stop signs or sidewalks. The more images they give, the more the machine can correctly identify those objects ‚Äî and when they‚Äôre absent or out of place. ‚ÄúSo far, based on their evaluation, we think our system is able to detect roughly like 87% accuracy,‚Äù said Xiaojun Qi, another investigator on the project and a professor with USU‚Äôs Department of Computer Science. The researchers have to manually label every image and then double-check the accuracy of all the data, as some mistakes can carry on into future prediction results, which takes a lot of time ‚Äî they've been doing this training since early 2023. However, that front-ended work makes analyzing the accessibility of intersections much faster. Joel Pierson, a computer science undergraduate at USU who‚Äôs working on this project, explained that they can run the AI model on every intersection of Logan in less than three minutes. The report that generates is color-coded based on how accessible different intersections are, which Qi says pedestrians, especially those with disabilities, could use to find the best route for getting around town. Working with cities on accessibility The tool isn‚Äôt only useful for individuals, however. Brent Chamberlain, the project‚Äôs principal investigator, said they can use it to help cities fill in gaps of data on accessibility. ‚ÄúMost communities don‚Äôt really have good data on the different components of mobility infrastructure,‚Äù said Brent Chamberlain, principal investigator with the project and an associate professor at Utah State University. ‚ÄúWe really need to know where these issues are so that we can plan ahead to fix them.‚Äù That may be all they do with some cities, but Chamberlain hopes that they can build longer-term partnerships that get into transitional planning as well. ‚ÄúThis is like, how do we do from where we‚Äôre at now to being ADA compliant,‚Äù Chamberlain said. ‚ÄúAnd ideally, it‚Äôs not just about compliance ... it‚Äôs about inclusivity for broader populations.‚Äù ‚ÄòBroader populations‚Äô isn‚Äôt just those with disabilities, either ‚Äî a wide variety of pedestrians benefit from accessibility features, such as older people, parents with strollers, those on bikes or scooters, or even just people who walk slower. ‚ÄúA lot of times, these accessibility accommodations benefit a much broader swath of the population than people consider,‚Äù Wappett said.

author: @nbcchicago
title: How cold is it really in Chicago How to calculate wind chill and what it means ‚Äì NBC Chicago
text: Thursday started off brutally cold in Chicago, with wind chills dipping below zero, but what exactly does that mean and how is it calculated? A wind chill is the "measure of how cold the air feels on your skin," NBC 5 Storm Team Meteorologist Kevin Jeanes said. "How cold it is, plus how strong the winds are," Jeanes said. So how do you determine just how cold it feels? The equation isn't quite as simple. How to calculate wind chills According to the National Weather Service , "wind chill is based on the rate of heat loss from exposed skin caused by wind and cold." "As the wind increases, it draws heat from the body, driving down skin temperature and eventually the internal body temperature. Therefore, the wind makes it FEEL much colder," the NWS reports. "If the temperature is 0¬∞F and the wind is blowing at 15 mph, the wind chill is -19¬∞F. At this wind chill temperature, exposed skin can freeze in 30 minutes." Local The formula used to calculate wind chill is: 35.74 + 0.6215T ‚Äì 35.75 (V^0.16) + 0.4275T(V^0.16) = Wind chill Feeling out of the loop? We'll catch you up on the Chicago news you need to know. Sign up for the weekly[> Chicago Catch-Up newsletter]. In this equation, the ‚ÄúT‚Äù variable represents the air temperature, while the ‚ÄúV‚Äù variable represents the wind speed. The formula also accounts for heat transfer theory and skin tissue resistance, according to the NWS. For example, an air temperature of 10 degrees, and a wind speed of 25 miles per hour will create a wind chill of approximately minus-11 degrees Fahrenheit. "Our bodies naturally give off heat," Jeanes explained. "The air just around our body warms up, but when when the wind picks up, that removes the heat. So our body heat that it naturally gives off isn't warming us anymore. It isn't keeping us insulated." According to officials, the formula takes into account a measurement of the wind speed as measured at the average height of a human face, which is five feet. It also takes into account that a typical anemometer, a device used to measure wind speed, is placed 33 feet in the air. In order for wind chill to be calculated, the air temperature must be at or below 40 degrees Fahrenheit, the NWS said. Finally, the formula assumes that measurements are taken at night, with no sunlight influencing the ‚Äúfeels-like‚Äù temperature.

author: lidiet mexicano
title: Reporta Protecci√≥n Civil saldo blanco en Monclova por fiestas navide√±as, dice Alcalde
text:
Reporta Protecci√≥n Civil saldo blanco en Monclova por fiestas navide√±as, dice Alcalde
MONCLOVA, COAH.- Un saldo blanco es lo que result√≥ de los festejos navide√±os en
Monclova, confirm√≥ el alcalde Mario D√°vila Delgado.
Luego de las celebraciones por la Nochebuena y Navidad, las autoridades municipales no registraron problem√°ticas graves en la localidad, solamente accidentes menores que no generaron situaciones fatales y pudieron ser controlados y atendidos.
TE PUEDE INTERESAR:
Se nota dinamismo en crecimiento de comercio exterior por aduana de Piedras Negras
‚ÄúHasta el momento tenemos un saldo blanco, ha habido situaciones de accidentes, situaciones en los retenes, el tema de los cohetes, pero fuera de eso Protecci√≥n Civil nos ha reportado solo algunos incendios‚Äù, expuso el edil.
Reiter√≥ que desde el inicio de mes de diciembre no se han tenido situaciones fatales hasta el momento y se espera que el a√±o se cierre de esa manera.
Advirti√≥ que los filtros antialcohol continuar√°n instal√°ndose en diversos puntos de la ciudad, para evitar que las personas conduzcan en estado de ebriedad y provoquen accidentes viales.

author: LevelUp
title: Gobierno de M√©xico indemniza a trabajadores de agencia de noticias Notimex y acaba huelga
text:
EFE Latam Gobierno de M√©xico indemniza a trabajadores de agencia de noticias Notimex y acaba huelga Leer todo el art√≠culo Agencia EFE 30 de diciembre de 2023, 3:39 a. m. ¬∑ 3 min de lectura
Ciudad de M√©xico, 29 dic (EFE).- Los trabajadores de la extinta agencia estatal mexicana de noticias Notimex concluyeron este viernes la huelga que manten√≠an desde febrero de 2020 luego de que el Gobierno cumpliera con el pago de indemnizaciones a los trabajadores del Sindicato √önico de Trabajadores de la agencia.
En un comunicado, la Secretar√≠a de Trabajo y Previsi√≥n Social (STPS) inform√≥ que hoy hizo el pago de las indemnizaciones ‚Äúen cumplimiento al Convenio de Terminaci√≥n de las Relaciones Colectivas de Trabajo acordado entre el Gobierno de M√©xico y la organizaci√≥n gremial‚Äù.
Se√±al√≥ que en cumplimiento a las instrucciones del presidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador se realiz√≥ el pago correspondiente ‚Äúcon pleno respeto a los derechos laborales de la organizaci√≥n sindical, de acuerdo con la Ley Federal del Trabajo‚Äù.
Esto, abund√≥, deriva de la mesa de trabajo que se sostuvo estos d√≠as en las instalaciones de la Junta Federal con representantes de las secretar√≠as de Gobernaci√≥n, del Trabajo, del INDEP, de Notimex y el Sutnotimex (Sindicato √önico de Trabajadores de Notimex), donde se aprob√≥ y suscribi√≥ la versi√≥n final del Convenio.
‚ÄúLleg√≥ el momento menos esperado para quienes trabajamos en la agencia de noticias del Estado mexicano que es el cierre definitivo‚Äù, se√±al√≥ en un breve mensaje a medios la secretaria general del Sutnotimex, Adriana Urrea.
Aclar√≥ que no fueron los trabajadores quienes decidieron cerrar la agencia, sino que fue la ‚Äúmala gesti√≥n‚Äù la que decidi√≥ no mantener este medio de comunicaci√≥n pues se argument√≥ que podr√≠a sustituirse con uno nuevo y que exist√≠a corrupci√≥n y falta de profesionalismo en los trabajadores.
‚ÄúHoy se baja el tel√≥n, se baja la cortina, se apagan las computadoras y se tapan los lentes de las c√°maras de Notimex, ya no se escuchar√° m√°s en los medios, en las salas de prensa, en las noticias informaci√≥n de Notimex‚Äù, dijo entre l√°grimas Urrea.
Indic√≥ que con ello se cierra un cap√≠tulo en la historia del periodismo de M√©xico y el mundo y se termina con la fuente laboral de m√°s de un centenar de trabajadores ‚Äúque lucharon, que dieron su vida por su fuente de empleo y que hoy fueron liquidados luego de 1.408 d√≠as de huelga‚Äù.
Continuar leyendo la historia En octubre pasado, el Gobierno de M√©xico, a trav√©s de la secretar√≠as de Gobernaci√≥n (Interior) y del Trabajo y Previsi√≥n Social (STPS), firmaron un acuerdo con el Sutnotimex en el que acordaron la decisi√≥n de desaparecer la agencia que con motivo de los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos en M√©xico 1968.
El conflicto laboral en la agencia estatal mexicana de noticias comenz√≥ en febrero de 2020 por el posible despido injustificado de al menos 200 colaboradores al interior de Notimex, principalmente mujeres, lo cual fue reprochado y defendido por el SutNotimex, sindicato que fue sustituido por la empresa a la llegada de su nueva directora, Sanjuana Mart√≠nez.
En distintas ocasiones, el presidente L√≥pez Obrador defendi√≥ el cierre de la agencia de noticias del Estado mexicano, Notimex, tras m√°s de tres a√±os del conflicto laboral que se inici√≥ durante su Gobierno.
"Se est√° buscando un acuerdo porque nosotros no necesitamos una agencia de noticias en el Gobierno, eso era de la √©poca de los boletines y de la prensa oficial y oficiosa, ya no hay eso", manifest√≥ varias veces desde el inicio del conflicto el mandatario.
(c) Agencia EFE
M√ÅS POPULARES 1. ‚ÄúEl dinero es sucio y peligroso‚Äù: La tendencia de los cajeros autom√°ticos inversos 2. Estos son los fraudes m√°s comunes relacionados con el Infonavit 3. ¬øPor qu√© est√° cayendo tanto el d√≥lar en Colombia al cierre de 2023? 4. D√≥lar en Colombia abre al alza, pero se mantiene en m√≠nimos de un a√±o y medio 5. Musk lidera el aumento del patrimonio de los m√°s ricos del mundo en 2023

author: Pulzo
title: Millonarios hoy: incertidumbre con decisi√≥n de jugar ante Alianza, en Valledupar
text: Noticias sobre Valledupar, el Cesar y el vallenato: art√≠culos, videos, fotos y el m√°s completo archivo de noticias de Colombia y el mundo en El Pil√≥n. [Visitar sitio](https://www.elpilon.com.co) El delantero colombiano [Radamel Falcao Garc√≠a](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/radamel-falcao-garcia) habl√≥ ante los medios de comunicaci√≥n luego de la derrota de Millonarios en calidad de local 2-1 contra el Atl√©tico Nacional, partido adelantado por la fecha seis de la Liga BetPlay. El atacante reconoci√≥ que pese a la derrota [Millonarios](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/millonarios-fc) jug√≥ un buen partido y que la expulsi√≥n del guardameta Iv√°n Arboleda condicion√≥ la estrategia que el equipo ten√≠a planteada para jugarle a los verdolagas. (Vea tambi√©n: [Falcao se cans√≥ y respondi√≥ a quienes lo critican por falta de gol: ‚ÄúEsto apenas comienza‚Äù](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/radamel-falcao-respondio-criticas-millonarios-dejo-advertencia-que-dijo-PP3819733)) Igualmente, el ‚ÄòTigre‚Äô entreg√≥ su concepto con relaci√≥n al pr√≥ximo compromiso de los ‚ÄòEmbajadores‚Äô, que ser√° el domingo ante Alianza FC en Valledupar. ‚ÄúPara el partido contra Alianza FC se pueden rescatar muchas de las cosas buenas que se hicieron en el partido contra Nacional, obviamente esperamos que la situaci√≥n sea diferente, que podamos estar con once jugadores para que no pase lo del partido de hoy‚Äù, dijo Falcao. [Falcao se cans√≥ y respondi√≥ a quienes lo critican por falta de gol: "Esto apenas comienza"](/deportes/radamel-falcao-respondio-criticas-millonarios-dejo-advertencia-que-dijo-PP3819733) ["¬øDe qu√© sirve? Hay que meterla": hincha de Millonarios, impaciente, explot√≥ contra Falcao](/deportes/hincha-millonarios-critico-reclamo-radamel-falcao-por-no-meter-goles-PP3819444) [¬øFalcao Garc√≠a les solt√≥ la mano a hinchas de Millonarios? Perder con Nacional fue duro](/deportes/nacional-le-gano-millonarios-falcao-garcia-dijo-que-no-fue-culpa-arbitro-PP3818797A) [Falcao, con sinsabor por derrota de Millonarios: "Con uno menos generamos m√°s peligro"](/deportes/falcao-hablo-derrota-millonarios-vs-nacional-quedo-disgustado-PP3818710A) Millonarios hoy: Gamero dio aviso sobre Falcao en Valledupar La expectativa crece al tiempo que hay incertidumbre, pues aunque el atacante samario quiere jugar, d√≠as atr√°s el entrenador [Alberto Gamero](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/alberto-gamero) dio a entender en rueda de prensa que no podr√≠a estar en todos los partidos, aunque los fan√°ticos del equipo albiazul que viven en la capital del Cesar esperan ver a su √≠dolo. La entrada [Falcao se pronunci√≥ con respecto al juego de Alianza FC contra Millonarios en Valledupar](https://elpilon.com.co/falcao-se-pronuncio-con-respecto-al-juego-de-alianza-fc-contra-millonarios-en-valledupar/) se public√≥ primero en [El Pil√≥n | Noticias de Valledupar, El Vallenato y el Caribe Colombiano](https://elpilon.com.co). LO √öLTIMO [Deportes] Hace 2 horas [üî¥ Juegos Ol√≠mpicos EN VIVO: Colombia busca hacer historia en tiro con arco por equipos](/deportes/juegos-olimpicos-vivo-colombia-enfrenta-prueba-tiro-con-arco-por-equipos-PP3838922) [Deportes] Hace 9 horas ["Una decepci√≥n": taxistas en Paris, enojados por cierres viales y plata que han perdido](/deportes/juegos-olimpicos-taxistas-paris-enojados-por-cierres-viales-alla-PP3838469) [Deportes]

author: Jan-Frederik Wendt
title: Musk bedauert √∂ffentlichen Streit mit Trump - Details zu Telefonat
text:
Musk bedauert √∂ffentlichen Streit mit Trump ‚Äì Milliard√§re telefonierten offenbar schon Anfang der Woche
Elon Musk hat im Streit mit Donald Trump einen R√ºckzieher hingelegt. Die ehemaligen Freunde sollen ein kl√§rendes Telefonat gef√ºhrt haben.
Update, 12. Juni, 08.44 Uhr: Elon Musk bedauerte in einem Beitrag auf seiner Social-Media-Plattform X seinen √∂ffentlichen Streit mit US-Pr√§sident Donald Trump. Musk schrieb am Mittwoch: ‚ÄûIch bedauere einige meiner Beitr√§ge √ºber Pr√§sident @realDonaldTrump letzte Woche. Sie gingen zu weit.‚Äú Nun wurde bekannt, dass der Tech-Milliard√§r zuvor wohl bereits am Montag mit Trump telefoniert hatte, wie mehrere US-Medien √ºbereinstimmend berichten. Au√üerdem soll Musk vor seinem Telefonat mit dem US-Pr√§sidenten mit Stabschefin Susie Wiles und Vizepr√§sident JD Vance gesprochen haben.
Erstmeldung: Washington, D.C. ‚Äì US-Pr√§sident
Donald Trump soll in Paranoia verfallen sein. Das hat der Bestseller-Biograf von Trump, Michael Wolff, im Podcast von The Daily Beast behauptet. Der Grund: Trump bewerte seinen Vizepr√§sidenten JD Vance als existenzielle Bedrohung, nachdem Tesla-Ceo Elon Musk Vance im Zuge eines √∂ffentlichen Streits mit Trump als dessen Nachfolger gefordert hatte.
Wolffs Vermutung:
Musks Forderung versetzte Trump in Angst und Schrecken. Er misstraue seinem Vize Vance nun noch mehr. Trump habe sich einst f√ºr Vance als Vizepr√§sidenten entschieden, weil Musk die Personalie zur Bedingung gemacht haben soll, dass er Trump mit seinen Millionen im Wahlkampf unterst√ºtzt.
Musk s√§te Misstrauen gegen Vance: Trump werde Loyalit√§t seines Vize testen
Der Autor vermutet, dass Trump seinen Vizepr√§sidenten k√ºnftig st√§rker unter die Lupe nehmen wird. ‚ÄûEr wird eine Reihe von Tests aufstellen, die Vance aushalten und bestehen muss‚Äú, mutma√üte Wolff im Podcast. Vance m√ºsse ‚Äûsich zu seiner absoluten Loyalit√§t gegen√ºber Trump bekennen, oder er wird innerhalb der Verwaltung an den Rand gedr√§ngt werden.‚Äú
W√§hrend des Streits mit Musk hatte sich Vance jedenfalls hinter Trump gestellt. ‚ÄûIch bin der Vizepr√§sident von Pr√§sident Trump. Meine Loyalit√§t wird immer dem Pr√§sidenten gelten‚Äú, hatte er betont. Musks Angriff auf Trump bezeichnete er als ‚Äûgro√üen Fehler‚Äú.
Hegt Trump Misstrauen gegen Vance nach Streit mit Musk?
In einer Erkl√§rung gegen√ºber The Daily Beast bezeichnete der Kommunikationsdirektor des Wei√üen Hauses, Steven Chung, Wolff als ‚Äûeinen Vollidioten, der aufgrund seiner eklatanten L√ºgen und Erfindungen weithin diskreditiert ist‚Äú. Chung sagte weiter √ºber Wolff: ‚ÄûEr ist ein Schwachkopf h√∂chsten Grades, und sein
vom Trump-Derangement-Syndrom verwirrtes Gehirn hat ihn dazu gebracht, ein erb√§rmliches Leben ohne Realit√§t zu f√ºhren.‚Äú
Laut Chung will Wolff nur relevant bleiben und Aufmerksamkeit erhalten: ‚ÄûNichts von dem, was er sagt, ist die Wahrheit, und er greift auf haarstr√§ubende Unwahrheiten zur√ºck, um relevant zu bleiben, denn Vater Zeit hat ihn schon vor 20 Jahren √ºberholt.‚Äú (Jan-Frederik Wendt)

author: AB Newswire
title: ZHIYUN Unveils CQ5 Smartphone Stabilizer with AI and Voice Control | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Compact and Powerful for Seamless Content Creation Shenzhen, China - October 17th, 2024 - ZHIYUN, the trailblazer in image stabilization equipment, has launched the CINEPEER CQ5 Stabilizer for content creators. The CQ5 lets anyone capture professional-quality footage, thanks to intelligent features like AI tracking and intuitive voice control, and ease-of-use features like the extendable rod. Now, smartphone users will unlock their creativity, and capture stunning content easily.
Hands-Free Operation with Voice Control
Just say, ‚ÄúHey Cami‚Äù, and voice commands give effortless control of the stabilizer. Users can focus on their content without worrying about physical adjustments: perfect for on-the-go shooting.
AI Tracking: A Personal Camera Assistant
The AI Tracker recognizes hand gestures, allowing for touch-free control from a distance. After tapping the target on the screen, intelligent tracking follows the target and creates smooth, professional footage. Whether vlogging solo or capturing action shots, the tracker is a personal camera operator, ensuring effortless recording even when the user is far from the camera.
Wide-Angle Shots, with Extendable Rod
The CQ5‚Äôs built-in extendable rod effortlessly extends users‚Äô reach to capture stunning wide-angle shots. From sweeping landscapes to group selfies, there are endless possibilities for dynamic compositions and creative angles, enhancing both photos and videos.
Magnetic Fill Light for Quality Footage
Fill lights snap onto magnetic contact points on both ends of the phone clamp, free from cumbersome cables. These fill lights deliver bright, high-quality footage in low-light environments, enabling users to create studio-grade results on the go.
Cinematic Effects from ZY Cami App
The CQ5 is powered by the ZY Cami App, which offers ready-to-use shooting templates for content creators of all skill levels. With features like SmartFollow, Timelapse, and MagicClone mode, users create cinematic videos even without advanced technical knowledge.
Compact, Foldable, Easy-to-use
The compact, foldable CQ5 that fits in a pocket. It‚Äôs the perfect go-anywhere, film-anything companion. Its sleek fold-and-go design and secure slide-lock mechanism, let users quickly pack up and carry the stabilizer anywhere.
Rock-Solid Stability: Anti-Shake Technology
The CQ5‚Äôs advanced anti-shake technology ensures unmatched stability for smooth footage, even in fast-paced action scenes. The quick mount design lets users set up and start shooting in seconds, regardless of their smartphone‚Äôs size.
All-Day Battery Life for Continuous Shooting
With up to 11 hours of battery life, the CQ5 supports all-day shooting and can charge while in use, ensuring that content creators never miss a moment. Whether capturing the sunrise or filming late into the night, the CQ5 meets creative users‚Äô demands.
Learn more
Recommended pricing (MSRP)
CINEPEER CQ5 Standard $99
CINEPEER CQ5 COMBO (with Magnetic Light and AI Tracker) $139
A 20% discount will be provided for purchases, with an extra 15% discount available by entering the discount code 'ZHIYUNCQ5'.
Where to buy
Available online from the ZHIYUN store and ZHIYUN Amazon store.
ZHIYUN Store: https://geni.us/CINEPEERCQ5
Amazon: https://geni.us/AMZ-CQ5-FLL
About ZHIYUN
ZHIYUN Tech is a pioneer and a world-leader in gimbals and stabilizers for everyone from professional filmmakers to amateur video creators. ZHIYUN believes in ‚ÄúMAKE IT REAL‚Äù: a commitment to arduous research and development to create breakthroughs in technological and industrial innovations. author: Melanie Epp
title: Opening of Mexican market for day-old chicks boosts Brazilian segment - ABPA
text:
Opening of Mexican market for day-old chicks boosts Brazilian segment - ABPAMexican flocks impacted by avian infleunza
The Brazilian Animal Protein Association (ABPA) celebrated the announcement made yesterday by the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock about the opening of the 1-day-old chick segment from Brazil to Mexico,
according to a recent market report from ABPA.
The announcement occurred after the official acceptance, by the Mexican authorities, of the International Zoosanitary Certificate (CSI) for the import of this high-value-added segment of Brazilian poultry farming.
‚ÄúMexican poultry farming has faced impacts on its flocks resulting from occurrences of avian influenza. In this sense, Brazil, which already supplies fertile eggs, now presents itself as a reliable partner for the supply of 1-day-old chicks," said Ricardo Santin, president of ABPA. "It is worth highlighting that it is another important achievement for Minister Carlos F√°varo and his team for Brazil."
‚ÄúThe expectation is that Mexico, which is already the largest importer of Brazilian fertile eggs, will also establish itself among the highlights in the 1-day-old chick segment," said Lu√≠s Rua, ABPA‚Äôs markets director. "It‚Äôs another seal of approval for Brazil‚Äôs biosecurity."
